website_summaries.verdict: A reliable product that will transport your baby securely. A good value for your money.
pros: A sturdy carrier made by one of the most trusted names in the industry
Provides nice structure that keeps baby secure
cons: Neck aches are fairly common after extended use, especially if not put on correctly

customer_reviews.title: I have a traveling buddy now! She loves house work!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I put our baby in this all the time. She is more comfortable in it now and tolerates me doing stuff around the house. Especially if she can scratch or hit whatever I am doing to keep her entertained. Hah. OLD: At this point in time, I have put our daughter in it once and after 5 minutes she had enough. I feel like it fits me well and that she is secure in it but I could tell she didn't feel comfortable in it. I'm hoping she changes her mind in the future because it would allow me to do stuff around the house if she is clingy that day.
customer_reviews.author: Darin G.

customer_reviews.title: And Grandmas love it too
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift I brought to my son for his 7 week old baby. 5 minutes every time we put the baby in his BabyJorn the baby fell asleep. Even when he was awake he never cried in his baby Bjorn. We were in China and visited some historical site full of 5 story buildings with no elevator. I had the baby in the Babyjorn for 3 hours and he never fussed or cried. This is a must have for every new parent! And Grandmas love it too!!
customer_reviews.author: maryannsue

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: We are using this carrier for 7 months already and we are completely satisfied with this one. It is adjustable to baby’s height and weight. We are using to both ways: baby facing my/my husbands chest (usually if she is sleeping during our walks) and baby facing the world around her (all the time that she is awake). Our little girl enjoys it. It really helps me to get my hands free for some stuff while I still can carry my baby around.
customer_reviews.author: Ana V

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING carrier!!!
customer_reviews.text: Baby Bjorn is AMAZING! I can't tell you how many different carriers I have went through trying to find the perfect one and I have FINALLY found the perfect fit!! I tried 3 different types of Ergos and ended up returning all three because they were either to bulky, to hot or just to uncomfortable for both baby and I. But I thought I'd give it one last go and order another carrier and oh am I glad I did! This is so comfortable, baby can be faced in or out, there's not infant insert required and it grows with baby! This is definitely a must have baby item!! Plus you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Item
customer_reviews.text: I have a newborn who likes to be with me all the time. That makes it difficult to complete tasks around my home so I like to baby wear. I have a couple of fabric wraps but didn't feel like they were secure enough. I bought this and love it. Baby is right on my chest and secure. I haven't worn this for hours but the hour that I did have it on the shoulder straps did not dig into me nor cause strain on my lower back. I'm really glad that I purchased this carrier
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Thank you. Thank you. Thank you.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Bought this for my grandson,s wife,s baby shower. I ordered it late and was hoping it would arrive in time. It arrived as was quoted, the morning of the shower. WOW, what a crazy concept. A company honoring there commitment to a customer. Shower was great. Baby carrier was just what she wanted. Grammy earned her five stars that day. Thank you Babyjorn and thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: cathyd

customer_reviews.title: SO easy to get on and off by yourself
customer_reviews.text: SO easy to get on and off by yourself, which is why I got it as an alternate to our other carrier. Worked great when I flew with my infant over the holidays too - kept her close and my hands free. You can go through airport security with it, and i kept it on most of the flight (comfortably)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... the baby ktan and ergo and this is my favorite so far
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used the baby ktan and ergo and this is my favorite so far. My newborn is 6lbs (minimum weight reccomended to use is 8lb) but this saves me when she is fussy and won’t let me put her down. I feel like she is secure with the adjustable head support straps. Very easy to get on and use - and super comfortable and secure. Life saver with a newborn and a 2 year old to chase around.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Best baby carrier money can buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best carrier money can buy! I went through 6 different carriers before I finally saw a girl using this one asked what it was bought it, and now I have bought a second one for my newest son.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Akers

customer_reviews.title: Everything was fine and finally my baby
customer_reviews.text: Revived the product today and went to the store with it. I have a big 9 week old baby so I needed to use it in the second setting that starts for babies 4+ months. The mesh under his legs seemed to leave marks on him so I put him shorts to avoid direct contact. Everything was fine and finally my baby, who gets too warm, was happy. I was NOT. After 20 minutes my lower back was hurting and later on worst. I put 4 stars because I do like it and it works but the lower back pain is terrible and I assume I won’t be able to use it for long walks
customer_reviews.author: antonella

customer_reviews.title: This has been perfect for my baby
customer_reviews.text: This has been perfect for my baby! It's very easy to get him in and goes over whatever your wearing easily too. It's lightweight and easy to carry around for when you need it. I have to get a bigger one now, because my son is 6 months and 22 pounds - at this point i very quickly get a very sore back when carrying him in here. It was perfect before he hit 20 pounds. I now need one with more support for my back.
customer_reviews.author: Mystic Mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to just throw in the car or under the ...
customer_reviews.text: My baby wants to be held all the time, and the wraps I've used around the house weren't providing enough support. Purchased this and use it around the house all the time, but also wherever we go. My 10 week old loves it, and people don't really even notice he's there! Easy to just throw in the car or under the stroller for "on the go".
customer_reviews.author: A. Cook

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: This is really easy to put together and get the baby in. Good especially if you are getting her out of the carsesat and into the carrier. Just a few snaps and it’s ready! Feels really secure. My baby is 8 weeks so I have only used it front facing so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: This carrier is awful
customer_reviews.text: It hurts my back and seem way too tight for my little girl. If she falls asleep, I get scared and have to stop every 5 minutes to check and see if she’s still breathing. The buckles and straps are so cumbersome. I don’t recommend AT ALL. Should have trown it away months ago.
customer_reviews.author: cocoshan

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing and we go everywhere in it
customer_reviews.text: I highly underestimated the need for a carrier. When our daughter was four days old I was desperate for one, and with my sleep deprived state I just couldn't figure out the directions for a wrap carrier. I hopped on Amazon and ordered this and it was in my hands before she was a week old. It's amazing and we go everywhere in it. My daughter is calm and soothed being close to my chest. It also fits my husband who wears a 2XLT (he's 6'4"). Get one!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: and it is as good as we hoped
customer_reviews.text: We have two Tula carriers, a Moby wrap, a Weego, a ring sling carrier, and a Baby Bjorn. Our daughter loves this carrier! She can be carried in the outward facing front carry which allows her to see everything around us and to observe various activities. We purchased the mesh version as we live in Florida and our daughter is a little fireball, and it is as good as we hoped. Highly recommend for smaller infants; however I can already tell that as she gets heavier the strain it puts on your shoulders and back may prove too much and we will need to utilize a different carrier at the time. It's great for younger infants.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Mama helper
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best baby carrier that I've tried so far. I can strap my 6 month old in and rest assured that she will stay safely put. This carrier gives me freedom to be able to use my hands again and is very helpful for those of us who are forced to work from home with no childcare. It is adjustable so Dad can wear baby in it too.
customer_reviews.author: MamaMissy7

customer_reviews.title: My favorite baby carrier
customer_reviews.text: I have now used this baby carrier for almost 19 months, and it is still going strong! I originally brought this carrier because I did not want to use a stroller to travel around the city. So far, my hubby, mom and I have used this carrier throughout the last 19 months; we are the #1 fans of this carrier due to its quality and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: carolyf

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I have a preemie, so super tiny and couldn't use ergobaby or similar things. This is super light weight, easy to wash and quick dry. very comfy for me to wear and put on and of. The baby fell asleep in 2 minutes in it. You will ned a hat or a head cover from the sun walking around, it doesn't have any over leap, but I'm ok with that. Just put on my baby some nice hat. The fabric its awesome soft
customer_reviews.author: Ajna Kenning

customer_reviews.title: A big no no if it doesn’t have a waist support
customer_reviews.text: The carrier itself is very well made. Very soft material, easy to put on. However, the fact that it doesn’t have a strap going around the carrier’s waist to help support the weight of the baby changes everything. It gives you so much pain and after 10-15 minutes it’s almost impossible to cArry your child. Worth spending more and getting one with a waist support
customer_reviews.author: Aida Khalatyan

customer_reviews.title: Bjorn and Ergo
customer_reviews.text: We have this as well as the ergobaby and love both. The pro's to this would be the size. The ergo is a little bit bulkier so I prefer to keep this one in the car for something quick to throw on while grocery shopping or whatever and the ergo baby I use around the house. I feel like the ergo baby is better for longer wear and the bjorn is best for shorter amounts of time.
customer_reviews.author: ktdnce

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t do without
customer_reviews.text: Our son loves to be able to look around. We started using it when he was about 1.5 months old and it has been used almost daily since. It is adjustable from 21” up to 26”+ kids at a maximum of 25lbs. It is much easier to put on and take off than the other brand we had and you can easily asjust it while it’s on you.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for newborns and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this baby carrier compared to any other carrier I have received as a gift or purchased. I wanted to find a carrier that would support my newborn and this product did it. I have used the wrap and have tried several different infantino brand carriers and none of them provided the support or comfort my baby needed. The bjorn baby carrier was also easy to assemble and was easier to get my baby in and out compared to all of the other carriers.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable for me or baby.
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed with this. Amazon had a used one for $35. I was so happy and couldn't wait to get it. Unfortunately, I'm not a fan. I tried putting my son in it when he was 8lbs (that's the minimum weight they recommend) and it was not comfortable for him at all. I tried again a couple weeks later when he was 10lbs, not much change.. Maybe when I can have him facing forward it will work better? I recommend getting an all cloth one that can form to you and babys body better.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Hands down best carrier. I have used both this and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Hands down best carrier. I have used both this and the ergo and prefer this (as have both of my kids). It’s comfy, easy to get on and off and feels very secure. The leg opening is suitable for an infant or older baby so you don’t have to purchase any additional attachments.
customer_reviews.author: LeahLeah

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, safe, easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: You will love this carrier, so sturdy and easy to put on with your baby in your arms. The material attracts a lot of hair and fuzzys so it looks kind of dirty but otherwise seems to be a great and ergofriendly buy. Used it three times already and found release for my back. My daughter loves it and seems more calm in it. There is enough yet not too much headroom to turn her head and practice lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Nice carrier
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used my Babybjorn carrier, I found all the clips and fasteners a bit complicated, but after using it once, it’s actually pretty easy. I feel like my baby is well supported, and my hands are free to help her big sister. I prefer this soft structured carrier over the wrap style because there’s really only one way to do it, and it’s easily to get the baby in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Winner for baby carriers
customer_reviews.text: Love my Baby Bjorn! The baby loves it and falls asleep in it every time. We tried the k'tan and loved the idea, but just couldn't get it to work. The Moby wrap is great as well, but it takes a long time to set up and the material is so hot for summer. The Baby Bjorn takes no time at all to put on and so simple to put baby in by yourself. The Ergo Baby that we tried took a while to get on, Baby was uncomfortable, and it was definitely a 2 person job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase. I was so overwhelmed with the options out there but when I saw this with a coupon to clip, I decided to try it. My baby fits in it perfectly with great head support so I can finally be hands free and it’s super comfy. Would recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Kate W

customer_reviews.title: Just get one
customer_reviews.text: Saw this on someone at the market and went straight home and bought it. It’s been great - it seemed to fit the hips on our LO better than any of the others.. we would certainly know because we bought a TON of other options. This one is affordable and the best support for baby and parent.
customer_reviews.author: StillAMystery

customer_reviews.title: Zero star if possible
customer_reviews.text: Made of 100% Polyurethane foam pad, which is toxic!! And online stated material is cotton. MADE IN CN (CHINA) AS STATED ON BOX. Highly disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: tennis4ever

customer_reviews.title: Great carrier for the price
customer_reviews.text: We love this carrier for places that strollers are a hassle. It's fairly easy to adjust for me and my husband to swap. However, my newborn was too small for it. I feel like this carrier is better for babies that are several months old (height more so than weight). It distributes weight evenly so it's easier to carry longer periods. I haven't used any other carriers or slings so I can't compare. Would use it again for my next baby.
customer_reviews.author: Stacegrz

customer_reviews.title: Not enough support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6months old 16lbs son; although it is very easy and quick to wear and set up it does not have enough support to carry the baby's weight, and so it makes it very very inconvenient for the parent. The baby seems pretty comfortable and for that reason I gave it two stars because their comfort is just as important. I have a sling baby carrier and it provides much better support, but it's longer to set up and I wanted something on the go. While shopping for a baby carrier look for one with a waist belt for that extra support to protect your lower back. Will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: danna B

customer_reviews.title: Very neat, stylish, well made, but Waaay TOO SMALL
customer_reviews.text: i love everything BabyBjor has to offer. Nice, simple, stylish, easy to wash/clean and excellent Swiss quality. It doesn't have anything you do not need, very thoughtful and yes, easy to put your baby in/our by yourself. However, my baby is 5 months (17lb, 24 1/2 inch) and we could barely stick him in there. He looked very uncomfortable. So I ordered BabyBjorn ONE (I believe) and this one is going back to Amazon. Also, I never had any carriers before, but this one seem to give pain to my back in the future. I think it's a great product for newborns up to 4 months old.
customer_reviews.author: anastasia

customer_reviews.title: big improvement over the original
customer_reviews.text: I've had both of these (the standard cotton and this mesh one) and despite what some other reviewers say, there's a HUGE difference in the breathability of this fabric. I have this thing on regularly on hot days, like REALLY hot days, and I can wear it comfortably for about an hour or so. With the standard black cotton model, you could count on my shirt being totally soaked where my son was pressed to my chest.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Gruber

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Can't see a need for the fancier Bjorns.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty fabulous! My baby loved snuggling close to mommy while tucked into this. I'm about 5'9" and used this without any discomfort until baby was about 9 months and then switched to the Ergo which was more comfortable for me with a bigger child. I loved both carriers but the Bjorn can be used for a smaller infant without the bulky extra insert the Ergo requires. I also love that the Bjorn allows baby to face outward once he has head control. I know some people find the Original Bjorn uncomfortable but my husband and I thought it was just fine and liked having the least bulky and fewest straps for as long as possible.
customer_reviews.author: shopper18

customer_reviews.title: Great for newborn stage - strains back later
customer_reviews.text: I love this carrier for the newborn stage. I would say that it does strain the back a bit when they’re a little bigger. My baby is now 15 pounds and it hurts my back to carry her for any extended period of time. I can’t imagine what it would be like when she’s closer to a year (she’s 6 months). It does give my baby great support though in both the out-facing and in-facing positions. For the first few months I think it’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Dina Elrashidy

customer_reviews.title: Arm holes too small!
customer_reviews.text: Overall this carrier is well made and durable, but the design is very strange. Unlike older models, the space for the arms is very small and restrictive. The older versions have a longer adjustable strap around the arm hole. This one is so short that my baby was clearly uncomfortable when he was still very small. I got this because I liked that the legs could fit comfortably and not be spread super wide like our Tula, and it is very easy to put on, but the arm holes were so bad we only used it 3-4 times before we gave up. Bummer to spend the money on something you can’t use!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good head support and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My two month old son was not a fan of wrap carriers. This one is great because it feels well structured and is easy to get him in and out of. He can also move his arms and legs a lot, which is what he really wants. I like the adjustable head support so that he can practice using those neck muscles or I can tighten it when he falls asleep.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: I like this carrier because it's so easy to put together ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this carrier because it's so easy to put together and go versus the wrap one that you can't even take with you in public because it's so hard to wrap around. For bigger babies though you will need something else. It depends how long you would like to use the carrier. I do have another one for when my son will be bigger so it's not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: oana spanti gattuso

customer_reviews.title: Good for little ones, Hurts shoulders
customer_reviews.text: The only carrier my newby fits in and one of the only ways she'll stop crying. I love that it's small and easy to bring with me in the diaper bag. Unfortunately it really hurts our neck/shoulders when we wear it. She also gets a bad heat rash when we use it. Glad I bought it, but I can't wait for her to fit in a different style carrier.
customer_reviews.author: J.Hart

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Baby Carrier
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as I was going to visit my 2 month grandson and I needed something to carry him in and the other ones that my daughter had seemed very complicated. This was easy to use, loved that I could unhook the front pack if he fell asleep. I was able to carry him on a walk and also around the house. My daughter now only uses this carrier as she also loves it
customer_reviews.author: gypsysforever

customer_reviews.title: no back support!!
customer_reviews.text: at first I loved this product however once my daughter turned a month and gained some weight ... I realized that everytime I used this my back was killing me! tried it different times and each time my back hurt.
customer_reviews.author: TY

customer_reviews.title: This is the carrier you have been looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I tried many different carriers, many different brands, and found all of them to bulky for my petite height and to hot to wear. Most carriers have buckles where its nearly impossible to put together yourself or to time consuming to put the carrier on. This carrier has all the buckles in front and you can put the carrier on in seconds! Lightweight and easy to put your baby in the carrier. Stop looking at other carriers, this is the one you need!
customer_reviews.author: Miss. D

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: We received several waps/carriers for shower gifts but they were very difficult to put on. We love our Bjorn because it's comfortable, easy to use, and our baby enjoys sitting in it. We do a lot of hiking and snowshoeing and have used the Bjorn for these activities many times.
customer_reviews.author: Bethlynn27

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! I bought this as a gift for a friend and both her and her husband love it. I had one when my daughter was a baby and I could not have made it through that stage without it. She was a fussy baby and this made life so much easier for both of us. I could get things done and she could be right there with me. My friend has a similar baby , so she too is finding the Baby Bjorn wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: it is just too much weight to only carry on your shoulders and stay comfortable, I ended up buying a different one with ...
customer_reviews.text: This carrier did not work so well for us, it is just too much weight to only carry on your shoulders and stay comfortable, I ended up buying a different one with more support and more weight put on the hips which works much better.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: I love this carrier it’s sturdy and designed well
customer_reviews.text: I love this carrier it’s sturdy and designed well. He only reason I didn’t give it 5 starts is that both me and my husband had a cramped back after and he is an athlete
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: My baby went through a phase where she screamed whenever she realized she wasn't being held. When we popped her in this, she fell right asleep and we could still get things done around the house. Plus, it's flu season and she hasn't been vaccinated yet, so I just stick her in this in public - no one can touch her, and her face is up by my face, so I can easily shield her from people hacking it up or smoking.
customer_reviews.author: Mkline13

customer_reviews.title: Came used
customer_reviews.text: It was clearly used and I paid for a new one, the fabric had a weird odor and was discolored and stretched out, it was easy to out together I did return it
customer_reviews.author: bells

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this! Easy to use and works great. My daughter is now 7 months but I've been using it since she was 7 weeks old (and she was a preemie, so pretty little at that age). I can wear her for long amounts of time and it doesn't hurt my back and allows me to be hands free. She loves being in it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really hate the waistbands on carriers like Ergo
customer_reviews.text: Every baby is different but this is the only carrier my little baby will allow. I really hate the waistbands on carriers like Ergo, so this is great as it just goes over the shoulder into a X on your back. Baby can face forward to if desired. I’d say greatflr babies 6mo and below.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree R.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had serveral almost carriers. This is by far my favorite. This is my second one I had given my first one away and then had a surprise pregnancy. It’s easy to use, has great structure, baby doesn’t flip around, and washable. Would be a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny! Bought this after using Ergobaby carrier. Unlike the ergo, this one requires zero help in strapping on and getting the baby in. Very light weight and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for small/lightweight babies
customer_reviews.text: Ideal for small babies, my baby don’t like very much to be put in but LOVED once he is set. Usually he sleeps while being charged. Truth is as he is getting heavier, the porter gets more uncomfortable. But I bought it for the first months only, don’t intent to port him when he’s +12lbs. All in all I find it great and recommend it if your porting expectations are limited and your baby is light-weighted (6 lb), otherwise I would suggest you go for a bigger/more structured porter.
customer_reviews.author: Floralis

customer_reviews.title: Loved it.
customer_reviews.text: I got this carrier because of the great price online. Then I received one of another brand as a gift. I ended up returning this one and regretted it. It is so much more comfortable and the latches and straps are less bulky compared to the other one. It's thinner which makes you think it's a bad thing but baby hates the extra padding and wants to feel me closer and she does with this one. Baby even fell asleep in this one after a few minutes of me doing stuff around house. She wont stay in other one for more than 5 minutes. Definitely worth it. ☺
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in between for soft wrap and complicated carrier
customer_reviews.text: Perfect carrier for newborn to one year. More support than a soft wrap carrier but not as bulky and complicated as a multi-position carrier. We have used this with our three month old since he was about 3 weeks old and about 7 lbs
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Ideal Carrier
customer_reviews.text: We've gone through a number of baby carriers, trying to find something secure and comfortable. I wish we'd started with this as it is by far the best and we've tried way more expensive ones like the Tula and Ergo360. Baby and mom and dad are all more comfortable in the baby Bjorn than any of the others. Very happy with this purchase. Only concern is that it only goes up to 22 pounds and therefore won't last us much longer.
customer_reviews.author: slando

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for both, but consider the mesh version
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, durable, easy to adjust and safe design. There isn't anything i can fault this carier for. But if i were to purchase a carrier again, i would go for the mesh version. For our climate it gets a little warm for the baby. That being said, everything else about this carrier is awesome. I would reccomend it highly. It was good when she was tiny, faving backwards, and the head support would keep her head from flopping around, and she loves it now forward facing with a good support to keep her shoulders firmly against your chest to prevent her wrigglig her way out.
customer_reviews.author: Michiel Van Overbeke

customer_reviews.title: It's a no for me
customer_reviews.text: Couls not be used on the newborn as stated had no support or anything so basically wasted my money and disappointed the friend I sent this to as a gift
customer_reviews.author: Lyrique

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and easy to use ! It wasn’t easy choice , so many different brand offering baby carrier but this one good for newborns , perfect for me ! Now I can walk my dogs hands free )))
customer_reviews.author: natalia

customer_reviews.title: love this thing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for carrying my daughter around. Durable and structured, I’m 5 feet tall I find this way easier than carrying around a car seat in stores
customer_reviews.author: Jpz

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is tried and true and still remains my favorite. I’m petite and this one is not bulky like so many others. It seems to fit me and my baby just perfectly. I have had several other more expensive carriers that I didn’t like nearly as much.
customer_reviews.author: Tnefaub

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this. I started my daughter off in this at 3 months old and she loved being able to see everything at the grocery store and I loved being able to shop with just a cart as opposed to cart and stroller or cart with car seat in it. She moves her arms and legs a lot in excitement when she is in this so she is getting exercise too. Now she is 8 months and it still works great. Adjusts easy, easy to put on, front and outward facing. It gets a little warm though from sharing body heat so I don't think this is a great thing for summer.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Great Baby shower gift.
customer_reviews.text: we used it a lot. My niece would not want to be in it if she is facing me though, so we have to fold the front part of it so she can bee in the front seat. Folding it was little hard but we used it so much it does not even matter, she would fall asleep in it. great support for your back. I recommend it. Makes a great baby shower gift.
customer_reviews.author: Lochana

customer_reviews.title: Bjorn...safe, comfortable, washable & adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Secure, washable and adjustable up to a point. I find that the product description in terms of the baby size 25 lbs and 66 cm is quite accurate. If your baby is bigger than this the carrier still works but it becomes more awkward as the babies head may be directly in front if your chin. We were given one as a shower present (we have twins) and tried a couple of other carrier makes because of the cheaper price they advertised. In the end they were all returned in favor of the better designed baby Bjorn... definitely worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: By far one of my most used and favorite things I have purchased for my son
customer_reviews.text: By far one of my most used and favorite things I have purchased for my son. It looks confusing when you first take it out BUT it's so super simple once you test it out. My son sleeps the entire time he is in this. He is very close to me and you can tell the position this carrier allows him to be in relaxes him greatly! I have nothing negative to say about this carrier. This will be my go to gift for all baby showers from here on.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd baby carrier that I tried and the best one! My little one doesn’t push away from my chest with it and he’s calm.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Works well -- kid can get hot
customer_reviews.text: If you're unsure if this is something you will want to use, then buying the original BabyBjorn from Amazon is your best bet -- you'll get a very functional product at a great price compared to Babies R Us or Buy Buy Baby. We use this product sparingly, but it is very handy in that it allows you to get your hands back and get some work done around that house while keeping your child safe and secure to you. Our child enjoys being in the harness. However, he will get hot if we are outside in the summer. If this is something you are going to use frequently, I would advise purchasing one of the higher-end, breathable models.
customer_reviews.author: E. Plautz

customer_reviews.title: ... this carrier a couple weeks ago and it works awesome for what I assume is any size baby (ours ...
customer_reviews.text: Wife bought this carrier a couple weeks ago and it works awesome for what I assume is any size baby (ours is just shy of two months). You can tighten the top so her head rests to your chest. We've taken it to the zoo (twice) with no complaints from my wife after using for a couple hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I love it, my wife hates it
customer_reviews.text: I love it because the weight of the baby is well distributed across hips, back, and shoulders. The thickness of material causes my wife to sweat too much
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Won’t regret.  Just get.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t live without it. Wife and I have very different schedule so with baby and walking both dogs it is a life saver. Easy enough for one person to put baby in safely. Calms him down when fussy. That is a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great, Gives Less Support than Others
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a baby gift for my brother for longer than Moby wrap trips and while it was a tough call because the design is much slimmer than the Lillebaby so it's great for around town, he went with Lillebaby due to it's extra support for hikes, which out weight it's bulky nature.
customer_reviews.author: mwayne

customer_reviews.title: Go for the one with the back support
customer_reviews.text: skip it and go for one of the pricier models with the back support. I know you've cut back on your pilates if you are even looking at these things and your back is likely not strong enough to tolerate this for very long. It's great, it's just not fair to your back - that very expensive extra back strap on the other models makes a big difference unless you only plan to use this for 15min or less at a clip. Consider finding a used one if the cost is the issue, but this model is really incomplete without the back strap.
customer_reviews.author: the revJ

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this item it's perfect. I am a large woman and was worried that an item like this would not fit me properly. But I decided to try it. It's perfect for any shape or size parent. My husband and I are exact opposites in body size and this adjusts perfectly for both of us. Our baby loves being in it. It's sturdy and safe. Next best thing to your own arms. Easy on the shoulders and back. Doesn't pull or strain on any one area, it evenly distributes the baby's weight so that you don't even realize you have it on.
customer_reviews.author: Amie Wickersham

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: very poor support returned it immediately and bought a lillebaby complete embossed instead!
customer_reviews.author: GMA817

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good Item
customer_reviews.text: This is not really the kind of thing a person like be gets excited about, but the quality of this product was jaw-dropping. In fact, it was such a nice kid-carrier that were nearly able to re-sell it for the Amazon price when our kid grew out of it. Being able to use it with the child either facing the parent or facing away was also a big help - apparently not all infant harnesses do that.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Trustworthy baby carrier!
customer_reviews.text: I love this baby carrier!!! I used this for both my kids... now I am re-buying for my niece. Very easy to use and excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Julie L

customer_reviews.title: Better than the body wraps!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this carrier after getting frustrated with the Moby and boba wraps. This was simple and fast to put together. Baby loves it and it feels so much more supportive!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use without any fancy frills
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use without any fancy frills. I tried 3 other carriers before this one, and I they all needed 2 people to safely get the baby in. I use this one alone every day, and it takes about 30 seconds to get it on and the baby in. Exactly what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Kannise

customer_reviews.title: HANDS DOWN MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.text: one of my greatest investments for myself and for my son. my wife is smaller than me so she says it hurts her shoulders but it works perfectly fine for me. i can go carrying him for hours and hours. longests i had him on there was 3-4 hours. in and out of course and no problems. just make sure you strap it on tight and pull the cords so it fits nice and tight on you. being loose may cause the issue of rubbing against shoulders while walking/moving.
customer_reviews.author: divineazn716

customer_reviews.title: Really nice!
customer_reviews.text: Great carrier for petite people. The straps fits my shoulders perfectly. You can adjust the straps easily and i feel good back support. The only thing I wish they have is a mesh material for baby’s back.
customer_reviews.author: Phung Vuong

customer_reviews.title: Not for large bustline
customer_reviews.text: After researching the best choice I decided on this one. I have a fairly large bustline and it doesnt fit. I ended up getting an evenflo.
customer_reviews.author: brittney martin

customer_reviews.title: Good carrier
customer_reviews.text: Being quite short (pretty miniature), the traditional slings I loved (Seven Sling) were only sufficient for a short period of time. Little bitty baby stage. Also, I wanted something with slightly more support than a traditional sling. The Bjorn worked pretty well for outings. My back only ached if I didn't have the little one in there correctly or if I didn't have the straps adjusted properly. I might purchase a Moby or Mei Tai for the next baby just to see if the straps are more comfortable resting against my body for longer periods of time. However, I will probably still use the Bjorn for the next baby, too,
customer_reviews.author: Jen Boat

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love this- after many attempts to get my newborn in slings and wrap carriers, this carrier was a snap to put on, and he actually seems to like being in it. No more spending tons of time trying to adjust a wrap around a squiggly baby! Strap it on, pop him in, and go!
customer_reviews.author: Maryla Judy Shaw

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the Bjorn!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several carriers, including the Moby wrap, and this one is by far the best. I think I like it most for the ease of putting it on or taking off. I can do it one-handed in less than a minute, which is great when you have a fussy baby on your hands. My daughter enjoys the Bjorn too, and squeals with excitement when she sees me grab it to put on. It is the most comfortable on my back as well, and I can wear her for a very long time (she's about 17lbs. now.) without feeling much strain on my back. I think a Bjorn is a must-have for every busy mom (or dad)!
customer_reviews.author: WesternGem

customer_reviews.title: Don't know what i'd do without it!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this carrier everyday from the time my baby was about a month old to now (9 months). She loves it and seems really comfortable. I love it because it keeps my arms free to do other things. We travel a lot and i would be lost without it at airports. I haven't tried any other carriers so can't compare but I am so happy with this one. After using it extensively, and putting it in the washing machine many times, it still looks like new. The fabric is amazing, mesh so it keeps cool, and it dries beautifully and fast after washing. I have the one in black/ blue.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. I use it for my baby since he was 2 months old. At first I had to hold the babies head because he could not sustain his head in an upward position. Now at three mons of age he has better control and he has been desensitized to being carried in the bjorn. I love it. It is secure, strong, durable. Overall great product.
customer_reviews.author: Paula G.

customer_reviews.title: It fits
customer_reviews.text: It works, that's all I have to say. the extra loops near the leg area that is supposed to help the close to newborn stay more secured didn't exactly have a use for it. I don't think babies near newborn of age should not be in this even though the box says that it is possible if this wanted to be used on them. My son like this carrier I feel like the tongue size on the bottom that you adjust by should not be what you use to judge so you can re size it should be by the baby. I sized mine correctly and it didn't fit my son.
customer_reviews.author: RedVenom

customer_reviews.title: I got this because of the adorable commercial with the little white dog
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, I got this because of the adorable commercial with the little white dog. Yes, I got this for my little white dog. Yes, I think it is worth the money. Secure feeling, soft, does not cut into my shoulders, just a great, quality product!! And the dog loves being close to his 'mommy'..Thanks, amazon, for the great commercial, and the great product at a great price!! Well worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: A Reader from PA

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and generally it is great
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality and generally it is great. I do wish I had gotten the active version with the lower waste strap though. I would like to use it while gardening and for other situations where you bend over, but the baby hangs to low and gets in the way. It is awesome for shopping and generally anything where you don't need to bend over a lot or use your hands extensively in front of you... you probably don't want chop vegetables while using it, for example.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: Might be the best thing ever invented for carrying around a baby
customer_reviews.text: I no expert in baby accessories but this thing is worth its weight in GOLD. I have used mine for hours and with all 3 of my children. Simply a homerun of a product and a must have for any new parent.
customer_reviews.author: Joey D

customer_reviews.title: Super helpful
customer_reviews.text: I'd give 4.5 stars if I could. I bought this so that I could finally have some hands free while baby and I are together. It was perfect for traveling. We used it to fly. There are no metal parts so I could walk right through the metal detector with baby sound asleep in the carrier. He can't sit on his own yet, and his car seat was taking up a ton of room in grocery carts, so using the baby bjorn to go grocery shopping has been a life saver. It does cause some back strain after a while, but for an hour or two it is ideal!
customer_reviews.author: WorkinMama

customer_reviews.title: The two month old baby wears a thicker yif in winter, which is too small to buy
customer_reviews.text: The two month old baby wears a thicker yif in winter, which is too small to buy
customer_reviews.author: Lan

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and easy to use. I am able to use this when I go to the paediatrician alone, which is mainly why I bought it. It has easy clips which mean I don't need any help getting it on and off and is comfortable for my newborn. Probably won't be able to use it when she is older though, as it doesn't have much back support.
customer_reviews.author: clrtlr

customer_reviews.title: Best baby carrier!
customer_reviews.text: Most trust worthy carrier we have and so much easier to put together. Highly recommend and worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Terri Jack

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product with one requirement in mind, ability to travel and go to touristy places without a stroller. This product has worked best for me. My son is comfortable in the carrier and seems to have fun too. Because of the rocking motion of our body also makes him sleep and goes to sleep. This product maynot work if you have a weak back, a 10-lb baby in front of your body puts extra stress on your back. So you need to have a good back to carry the baby around for even 30min. And no big belly carriers :) Other than that this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Nadar

customer_reviews.title: Baby doesn’t sit straight in it.
customer_reviews.text: I know people love these. I couldn’t quite get me infant to sit right in this. She was hunched over pretty bad. The straps are super easy to adjust and super simple to put your baby in. I wish i was able to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Lealolol

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this carrier
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this carrier! Frees up both of your hands to get stuff done around the house or perfect for taking the dog for a walk when you don't have to load up the stroller! Perfect support for infant, used from the time she was 8lbs 7oz and still using at 2 months and about 14lbs!
customer_reviews.author: cmaze

customer_reviews.title: Keeps baby protected and cool.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love our Baby Carrier. We use it around the house to clean up and take baby with us. It also came in handy when going shopping, allowing us to have our hands free. We are still using it, but now that she's 8 months, she's getting heavy and although the unit can take it, I can't carry an extra 20 lbs without getting tired easily! The material is vented, to help keep the baby cool. Since both my baby and my husband are warm by nature, this came in very handy. It is easy to adjust. Baby can face in or out, but only on your chest (not on your back).
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Mitchell
